data.title: inexpensive breakfast
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for breakfast .It is a different kind of place in décor but service and food was very good and we both enjoyed it. We had a standard breakfast along with a bag of beignets and it was all good.

data.title: Very good
data.text: I had one of the Po'Boys and it was very good.  It tasted light and fresh.  It's a very casual atmosphere and the staff is very friendly.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Stopped here our first day in NOLA for our first poboy. Had fried oysters, with a side of beans and rice and cheesy grits. Boy, was it all so good! So good in fact we returned for our last meal before leaving NOLA. This time had shrimp and greens poboy and another beans and rice. Omg, the shrimp and greens were unbelievable and the beans and rice just as good as the first time! Nothing fancy, mostly local business folks. Highly recommend!

data.title: Great Lunch in Unlikely Package
data.text:
I almost didn't go in. The windows and floor are pretty dusty. But there seemed to be a pretty trendy clientele inside. What good food! I had a shrimp po' boy with cole slaw and pickles. I wasn't sure about that combo but it was the right mixture of sweet and tangy. I shared some red beans and rice with my sister -- to die for! And I topped it off with my favorite southern beverage: sweet tea.

Going back again before we leave later in the week. Be sure to try it!

data.title: Don't judge this book by its cover!
data.text: My sister and I came to New Orleans for a quick vacation and stayed in a hotel near The Store. The restaurant had a small coffee shop vibe that was pretty sparsely decorated. The breakfast/lunch restaurant is in the business district so workers of all types came in steadily while we were there. You place your order at the counter and wait staff  bring it to your table. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Since it was our first visit, we asked for recommendations. They serve salads, sandwiches, burgers and southern fare. My sister got the shrimp n slaw po boy and I got the fried shrimp with greens po boy and we shared a small bowl of red beans and rice. EVERYTHING was delicious! The bread on the po boy was the right mix of crusty(not tough) yet light. The pickles and slaw on the shrimp n slaw po boy added a slight sweetness to the sandwich but it didn't overpower it. I was skeptical about the collard greens on my po boy but wow! The taste was an explosion of flavor! We  topped our meals off with some very tasty sweet tea. The portions were large and super filling; costs for most meals start at $7- $15. We definitely will return to this  place again!

data.title: Great lunch if you are downtown
data.text: Nice selection of soups, salads, sandwiches plus daily specials. Portions are generous and everything is prepared fresh. Be prepared to wait in line to place your order as this is a popular place with locals working downtown.

data.title: Awesome food
data.text: Great lunch stop. My family had the cuban, Ruben, veggie pockets and the cheddar burger. Everything was fantasitc! Service was great. Really a cute place. Love the story behind it (on the wall when you come in to the right).

data.title: Must Visit!!!
data.text: This restaurant is amazing because the food is absolutely good.  My family and I stop here for lunch and we are glad.  The atmosphere was a good hearted friendly feeling, open space and great oldie music.  It's on an one way street and parking is limited with paid meter.  The Chief came out and spoke with us, which was awesome and much appreciated.  Clean and neat resturant  plus the area space is huge.  This place definitely  deserves a second visit.  Check it out for yourself.  Enjoy!!

data.title: Always Awesome!
data.text: We order take-out from this restaurant often and thoroughly enjoy the food.  Everything we have ever tried has been outstanding. Great value for the price.

data.title: More than I expected.
data.text: We were walking around NOLA trying to find lunch. We stumbled across this place by mistake. The guy behind the counter probably thought I was crazy. I ordered a pulled pork sandwich, a bowl of gumbo, potato salad, mac and cheese, and beneighs.  All of which were great! The potato salad was amazing! It was made with green onions and creole mustard. I didn't even come close to finishing my lunch. Classic comfort food!

data.title: Great lunch
data.text:
This place is a little off all of the action, and seemed like a local lunch favorite for people who work in the city. We only found it because it was right across the street from our hotel. 
The po' boys were absolutely delicious. I got the catfish one, and my husband got the shrimp. Both were out of this world. Highly recommend for lunch.

data.title: Good Grub
data.text: We got the tomato basil soup and shrimp and cole slaw po' boy.  Both were excellent.  Menu is pretty diverse.  One of the guys behind the counter gave us more recommendations than you could shake a stick at.

data.title: Wish we could of reviewed the food
data.text:
The menu on the outside of the store looked just great, with the "OPEN" sign flashing in the window, we decided this was just what we were looking for. Upon entering we were stopped at the door by a rude & curt staff member saying they did not open for lunch until 11am, as it was 10:45, perhaps better customer service may have been to invite us in & we would of gladly waited until lunch time...
We have found the folk of New Orleans so friendly with this being our only exception!

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: Great food good price quick service. It much more I can say. Came here for a business meeting and the only small bad thing it's a little loud

data.title: Go here if in a hurry & appreciate traditional American dishes.
data.text: We've been eating breakfast here most of the week. Because of the quick express style of service and the good food it's easy to understand why we continue to return.

data.title: Great potato salad
data.text: Walked in for late lunch. Shrimp/slaw po'boy, oyster po'boy, chicken/sausage gumbo. All very tasty! Polite staff. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Red Beans and rice the right way!
data.text: Had lunch here two days while in New Orleans.  The price was reasonable especially for the enormous portions.  We had tried several places previously and had tried the red beans and rice...but none were good.  Being southern, and having traveled to NOLA several times previously, I KNOW what it's supposed to taste like, but this was the first time that they were done right.  I had the burger the first day with red beans and rice.  Myy husband had the oyster po boy the next time we went.  The po boy was HUGE...more than enough for two people.  He also ordered a side of grits...again enough for two, while being wiser I only ordered the red beans.  The grits were super creamy...a texture I'd been trying achieve for a long time.  The cook was gracious enough to tell me the secret to getting the grits to that creamy texture...the first one ever to let me in on the secret!  THANK YOU!!!!  This is DEFINITELY a must visit at least for lunch...I never made it for breakfast!

data.title: Wow what a great lunch!
data.text: We walked over for lunch and so glad we did. The menu was great. I had a 'cup' of the gumbo which was more like a bowl and delish! I also ordered the Cuban Sandwich and it was great! The bread was fantastic and the ham & pork was great. I couldn't finish it but I wanted to so bad! If I didn't have a dinner reservation I might have tried.

data.title: Wonderful selections and reasonable prices
data.text:
I adore their salads: Apple and Brie; Goat cheese and candied Pecans were both delicious and I'll be back to try others. 

Other dishes ate also great!  Consider visiting with a friend and splitting a salad and hot dish for a perfect meal!  The daily specials are always really special and yummy too!  Thursdays Crawfish Risotto was soooo good. 

There's also a taco bar in the next room which I'm looking forward to trying at a future visit.

data.title: Awesome Breakfast
data.text: It looked like it wasn't going to be great, as it wasn't too busy on a recent mid-week morning, yet we were wrong.   Great selections for breakfast, different, but awesome.  I had eggs with bbq (I combo I had never had prior) and they were awesome.  Others had breakfast taco's, or other breakfast type creations.  All good, and price was right.
